chapters.name: The Portrait of a Lady (Prose)
chapters.description: A touching story by Khushwant Singh that beautifully captures the relationship between the author and his grandmother, highlighting themes of love, companionship, and the passage of time.

questions.question: What was the 'happiest half-hour of the day' for the grandmother?
Describe the author's relationship with his grandmother in the village.
questions.correctAnswer: In the village, the author and his grandmother were constant companions. She would wake him up, get him ready for school, and accompany him. While he studied, she read scriptures in the temple attached to the school.

chapters.name: A Photograph (Poem)
chapters.description: A poignant poem by Shirley Toulson where she looks at an old photograph of her mother's childhood. It explores themes of memory, loss, and the transient nature of human life compared to the permanence of nature.

questions.question: What does the word 'cardboard' denote in the poem?
What does the poet mean by 'Its silence silences'?
questions.correctAnswer: This phrase refers to the profound silence and sense of loss the poet feels after her mother's death. The silence of the photograph (representing the past) and the silence of her mother's absence makes the poet speechless with grief.

chapters.name: We're Not Afraid to Die... if We Can All Be Together (Prose)
chapters.description: An adventurous account by Gordon Cook and Alan East about a family's perilous sea journey. It highlights themes of courage, perseverance, and the bond of family in the face of overwhelming odds.

questions.question: Who were the two crewmen the narrator hired to help them on their voyage?
questions.correctAnswer: The two crewmen were Larry Vigil, an American, and Herb Seigler, a Swiss.

chapters.name: The Summer of the Beautiful White Horse (Snapshot)
chapters.description: A story by William Saroyan about two poor Armenian boys, Aram and Mourad, who belong to a tribe known for its honesty. Their love for horses leads them to 'borrow' a beautiful white horse, challenging their values.

chapters.name: The Laburnum Top (Poem)
chapters.description: A beautiful poem by Ted Hughes that describes the arrival of a Goldfinch on a silent Laburnum tree. The poem illustrates the wonderful interaction between nature's elements, bringing life and energy to the scene.

questions.question: What is the significance of the laburnum tree in the poem?
questions.correctAnswer: The Laburnum tree, initially silent and still, symbolizes a dull or empty existence. It comes to life with the arrival of the goldfinch, representing the vibrancy and energy that relationships and interactions can bring.

chapters.name: Grammar: Tenses and Reported Speech
chapters.description: This section covers fundamental grammar rules focusing on the correct usage of tenses to denote time and the transformation of sentences from direct to indirect speech (reported speech).

questions.question: Choose the correct form of the verb: He ___ to the library yesterday.
Change into reported speech: He said, 'I am writing a letter.'
questions.correctAnswer: He said that he was writing a letter.
